Your whole body is racked with pain as youcrash onto the ledge. You're shaken and bruisedbut still alive! A snowbank cushioned your fall. "HELP!" you cry."Hold on!" Larsen yells. "It's going to be tricky,but we're rigging our ropes. We'll get you up." You feel a flash of joy; then you remembersomething that chills you to the bone. You werevery careful not to fall in. You're quite sure youdidn't slip; you were pulled as if by an unknownforce within the Bottomless Crevasse. Should you warn your friends about thestrange force? If you do, they may be afraid to getclose enough to rescue you

If you warn Larsen and Sneed If you just yell, "Please hurry!"
